award_name.ja: 平成2年度電気学会優秀論文発表賞

paper_title.ja: Fabrication of organic thin-film transistor using soluble dibenzochrysene

paper_title.en: Fabrication of organic thin film transistor using souble dibenzochrysene

description.en: Dibenzo[g,p]chrysene (DBC), which belongs to a cyclic aromatic hydrocarbon similar to pentacene, is drawn attention to. DBC is soluble and dissolves in THF, etc. We estimate the crystal structure of DBC by XRD and the morphology of evaporated and spin-coated DBC thin film by atomic force microscope. DBC is used as the active layer of organic thin-film transistor (TFT). The TFT characteristics cannot be obtained in a top contact-type TFT structure, but those can be done in a bottom contact-type TFT structure using SiO2/Si substrate. Unfortunately, the TFT mobility is 10-5 cm2/Vs-order and poorer than that of pentacene TFT because of broken carrier paths between DBC grains and many discrete valleys. © 2010 CPST.

publication_name.en: Journal of Photopolymer Science and Technology

paper_title.ja: EL Behavior for Blue-Emitting Aluminum Quinoline-Based Organic Light-Emitting Diodes

paper_title.en: EL Behavior for Blue-Emitting Aluminum Quinoline-Based Organic Light-Emitting Diodes
Novel tandem cell structure of dye-sensitized solar cell for improvement in photocurrent

description.en:
A novel tandem cell structure is proposed to improve photocurrent of dye-sensitized solar cells (DSCs). Front and back parallel photoelectrodes are placed face-to-face
 a common Pt-mesh counter electrode with transmittance is inserted between the electrodes. The short-circuit current density (Jsc) for the tandem cell is equivalent to the sum of the Jsc for the front and back photoelectrodes. A model using light energy absorbed by the photoelectrode is used to evaluate appropriate TiO2 film thickness of the front photoelectrode. The Jsc for the tandem cell was improved to 13.3 mA/cm2 for a cell with a 7.8-μm-thick front photoelectrode. The novel tandem cell has a great potential to improve DSC photocurrent and performance. © 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Novel tandem cell structure of dye-sensitized solar cell for improvement in photocurrent

description.en: A novel tandem cell structure is proposed to improve photocurrent of dye-sensitized solar cells (DSCs). Front and back parallel photoelectrodes are placed face-to-face; a common Pt-mesh counter electrode with transmittance is inserted between the electrodes. The short-circuit current density (J(sc)) for the tandem cell is equivalent to the sum of the J(sc) for the front and back photoelectrodes. A model using light energy absorbed by the photoelectrode is used to evaluate appropriate TiO2 film thickness of the front photoelectrode. The J(sc) for the tandem cell was improved to 13.3 mA/cm(2) for a cell with a 7.8-mu m-thick front photoelectrode. The novel tandem cell has a great potential to improve DSC photocurrent and performance. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Application of organic bathocuproine-based alloy film to organic light-emitting diodes

description.en: Bathocuproine (BCP) is well known as a hole-blocking material and is often used in organic light-emitting diodes and organic solar cells. However. BCP film is immediately polycrystallized after vapor deposition. We achieved stabilization of vacuum-deposited BCP-based thin film using the organic alloy method. Organic alloy method led not only to the suppression of crystallization but also to improvement of electroluminescence properties of devices using a hole-blocking layer. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Application of organic bathocuproine-based alloy film to organic light-emitting diodes

description.en: Bathocuproine (BCP) is well known as a hole-blocking material and is often used in organic light-emitting diodes and organic solar cells. However. BCP film is immediately polycrystallized after vapor deposition. We achieved stabilization of vacuum-deposited BCP-based thin film using the organic alloy method. Organic alloy method led not only to the suppression of crystallization but also to improvement of electroluminescence properties of devices using a hole-blocking layer. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Suppressive effect of a self-assembled monolayer on the polycrystallization of naphthyl-substituted diamine derivative thin film

description.en: We observed the polycrystallization process of a naphthyl-substituted diamine derivative (NPD) thin film on a self-assembled monolayer (SAM)-modified indium-tin-oxide (ITO) substrate. Fluorine-substituted SAM suppressed the growth of the polycrystalline region. After estimating the surface morphology of the polycrystalline region using AFM measurement, correlation between the molecular migration rate on the substrate, the rearrangement rate at the growth point, and the provision rate from the amorphous region clarified the polycrystallization growth mechanism for the NPD thin film. The formation of a channel around the polycrystalline region and the molecular migration rate on the substrate play important roles in polycrystalline region growth. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Suppressive effect of a self-assembled monolayer on the polycrystallization of naphthyl-substituted diamine derivative thin film

description.en: We observed the polycrystallization process of a naphthyl-substituted diamine derivative (NPD) thin film on a self-assembled monolayer (SAM)-modified indium-tin-oxide (ITO) substrate. Fluorine-substituted SAM suppressed the growth of the polycrystalline region. After estimating the surface morphology of the polycrystalline region using AFM measurement, correlation between the molecular migration rate on the substrate, the rearrangement rate at the growth point, and the provision rate from the amorphous region clarified the polycrystallization growth mechanism for the NPD thin film. The formation of a channel around the polycrystalline region and the molecular migration rate on the substrate play important roles in polycrystalline region growth. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Preparation, photocatalytic activities, and dye-sensitized solar-cell performance of submicron-scale TiO2 hollow spheres

description.en: We prepared submicron-scale spherical hollow particles of anatase TiO2 by using a polystyrene-bead template. The obtained particles were very uniform in size, with a diameter of 490 rim and a shell thickness of 30 nm. The Brunauer-Emmett-Teller surface area measurements revealed a large value of 70 m(2)/g. The photocatalytic property was investigated by the complete decomposition of gaseous isopropyl alcohol under UV irradiation. It was indicated that the activity of the hollow spheres was 1.8 times higher than that of the conventional P25 TiO2 nanoparticles with a diameter of 30 nm. Furthermore, we fabricated a dye-sensitized solar cell (DSC) using an electrode of the TiO2 hollow spheres, and examined the photovoltaic performance Under simulated sunlight. Although the per-area efficiency was rather low (1.26%) because of a low area density of TiO2 on the electrode, the per-weight efficiency was 2.5 times higher than those of the conventional DSCs of TiO2.

paper_title.en: Effect of self-assembled monolayer on electroluminescence properties of organic light-emitting diodes

description.en: We investigate the effect of a self-assembled monolayer (SAM) as a hole injection layer on the electroluminescence (EL) properties of organic light-emitting diodes (OLEDs). We modify the surface of an indium-tin-oxide (ITO) substrate using (heptadecafluoro-1,1,2,2-tetrahydrodecyl)triethoxysilane (F-SAM) and n-decyltriethoxysilane (CH3-SAM). The current of the OLED with F-SAM is higher that those of the OLEDs with or without CH3-SAM at the same voltage and the same as that of an OLED with copper phthalocyanine (CuPc). In addition, the half-lifetime of the OLED with F-SAM is 2500 times greater than that of the OLED without the hole injection layer and about twice that of the OLED with CuPc. We discuss the conduction mechanism of the OLED in terms of the barrier height of the hole injection and the voltage distribution of the organic layers.

paper_title.en: Polycrystallization phenomena of organic alloy and multilayer structures on naphthyl-substituted diamine-based hole transport layer for organic light-emitting diode

description.en: We demonstrated the poycrystallization process of N,N'-di(1-naphthyl)-N,N'-diphinyl-1,1'-diphenyl-1,4'-diamine (NPD) and N,N'-diphenyl-N,N'-bis(3-methylphenyl)-1,1'-dipheyl-4,4'-diamine (TDP), which is well known as a hole transport material, and the availablility of the organic alloy method fabricated by co-evaporation method. We fabricated multi-layer structure of NPD and TPD: especially bilayer as a basic and typical structure. One is TPD layer on NPD layer (T/N specimen) and the kkother is NPD layer on TPD layer (N/T specimen). The polycrystallization of bilayer structure specimens is suppressed as compared with organic NPE:TPD-1:1 alloy specimen. Especially the T/N specimen is found to be stable in an amorphous region. (C) 2008 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA STATUS SOLIDI C - CURRENT TOPICS IN SOLID STATE PHYSICS, VOL 5, NO 9

description.en: We investigate the effect of a self-assembled monolayer (SAM) as a hole injection layer on the electroluminescence (EL) properties of organic light-emitting diodes (OLEDs). We modify the surface of an indium-tin-oxide (ITO) substrate using (heptadecafluoro-1,1,2,2-tetrahydrodecyl)triethoxysilane (F-SAM) and n-decyltriethoxysilane (CH3-SAM). publication_name.en: PHYSICA STATUS SOLIDI C - CURRENT TOPICS IN SOLID STATE PHYSICS, VOL 5, NO 9

paper_title.en: Control of electroluminescence spectra using hole-blocking layer for white organic light-emitting diodes

description.en: We reviewed white organic light-emitting diodes (WOLEDs) briefly in this paper and suggested the significance of a hole-blocking material for the fabrication of WOLEDs. And we studied the electroluminescence (EL) spectra of two kinds of WOLEDs using each different hole-blocking material. The WOLED with blue-emitting aluminum quinoline (BAlq) had a broad EL spectrum. The broad spectra were caused by overlapping three emissions of 3 kinds of emission materials due to wide recombination zone. The WOLED with bathocuproine (BCP) showed two separated emissions. The difference between two specimens was concluded by strong hole-blocking property of BCP. The introduction of BCP produced a recombination zone due to hole accumulation at the BCP interface. ©2008CPST.

publication_name.en: Journal of Photopolymer Science and Technology

paper_title.en: Modification of ionization potential of poly(ethylene dioxythiophene): Poly(styrene sulfonate) film by acid or base treatment

description.en: We studied the effects of surface treatments on the surface electronic state of the poly(3,4-ethylene dioxythiophene):poly(4-styrene sulfonate) (PEDOT:PSS) film. The surface treatments performed were immersion of the PEDOT:PSS film in an acid or base solution, and the exposure of the PEDOT:PSS film to acid or base vapor. The ionization potential (I-p) of the PEDOT:PSS film is modified between 4.5 and 5.3 eV by surface treatments. I-p tends to be increased by acid treatment, although it tends to be decreased by base treatment. Because I-p is modified even by brief treatments, the modification is thought to result from surface condition changes. Measurements using X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), resistivity, and optical absorbance revealed that an electric double layer might have been formed on the surface of the PEDOT:PSS film by the treatment. The electric double layer shifts the vacuum level. Assuming the formation of an electric double layer, we can describe I-p modification by the treatment.

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS BRIEF COMMUNICATIONS & REVIEW PAPERS

description.en: We studied the effects of surface treatments on the surface electronic state of the poly(3,4-ethylene dioxythiophene):poly(4-styrene sulfonate) (PEDOT:PSS) film. The surface treatments performed were immersion of the PEDOT:PSS film in an acid or base solution, and the exposure of the PEDOT:PSS film to acid or base vapor. The ionization potential (I-p) of the PEDOT:PSS film is modified between 4.5 and 5.3 eV by surface treatments. I-p tends to be increased by acid treatment, although it tends to be decreased by base treatment. Because I-p is modified even by brief treatments, the modification is thought to result from surface condition changes. Measurements using X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), resistivity, and optical absorbance revealed that an electric double layer might have been formed on the surface of the PEDOT:PSS film by the treatment. The electric double layer shifts the vacuum level. Assuming the formation of an electric double layer, we can describe I-p modification by the treatment.
